target_text: "It is difficult to define and measure. That’s for sure. I think before agile, there was a great focus on product level quality. Mainly free of defects and meets customer’s needs. I saw in agile a shift toward code quality and a design that responds to change. There is also a continuous improvement of the process effort."

Codebook.Definition: The challenge of clearly defining and measuring concepts, indicating ambiguity in understanding.
The emphasis on ensuring that products are free of defects and meet customer needs prior to the adoption of agile methodologies.
The transition in focus from general product quality to specific aspects of code quality within agile practices.
The ability of design to adapt and respond to changes, highlighting flexibility in development processes.
The ongoing effort to enhance processes, indicating a commitment to evolving practices over time.
